00059 // Adding your plugin involves two edits here.
00060 // First, add an extern like the others
00061 // Second, add it to the available_generators immediately after
00062 
00063 #ifdef OBDSIMGEN_RANDOM
00064 extern struct obdsim_generator obdsimgen_random;
00065 #endif //OBDSIMGEN_RANDOM

00068 #endif //OBDSIMGEN_CYCLE

00122 /// Default sim generator for windows users is the gui
00123 #if defined(OBDSIMGEN_GUI_FLTK) && defined(OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS)
00124 #undef DEFAULT_SIMGEN
00125 #define DEFAULT_SIMGEN "gui_fltk"
00126 #endif

00129 /// Initialise the variables in an ECU
00130 void obdsim_initialiseecu(struct obdgen_ecu *e) {
00131     e->simgen = NULL;
00132     e->ecu_num = 0;
00133     e->seed = NULL;
00134     e->lasterrorcount = 0;
00135     e->ffcount = 0;
00136     e->dg = 0;
00137     e->customdelay = 0;
00138     memset(e->ff, 0, sizeof(e->ff));
00139 }
00140 
00141 /// Initialse all variables in a simsettings
00142 void obdsim_initialisesimsettings(struct simsettings *s) {
00143     s->e_autoprotocol = 1;
00144     set_obdprotocol(OBDSIM_DEFAULT_PROTOCOLNUM, s);
00145 
00146     s->benchmark = OBDSIM_BENCHMARKTIME;
00147     s->e_currentvoltage = OBDSIM_BATTERYV;
00148 
00149     s->device_identifier = strdup("ChunkyKs");
00150     s->elm_device = strdup(OBDSIM_ELM_DEVICE_STRING);
00151     s->elm_version = strdup(OBDSIM_ELM_VERSION_STRING);
00152 
00153     s->ecu_count = 0;
00154     int i;
00155     for(i = 0; i<OBDSIM_MAXECUS; i++) {
00156         obdsim_initialiseecu(&s->ecus[i]);
00157         s->ecudelays[i].ecu = NULL;
00158         s->ecudelays[i].delay = 0;
00159     }
00160 
00161     obdsim_elmreset(s);
00162 }
00163 
00164 /// Do an elm reset [ATZ or similar]
00165 void obdsim_elmreset(struct simsettings *s) {
00166     s->e_headers = ELM_HEADERS;
00167     s->e_spaces = ELM_SPACES;
00168     s->e_echo = ELM_ECHO;
00169     s->e_linefeed = ELM_LINEFEED;
00170     s->e_timeout = ELM_TIMEOUT;
00171     s->e_adaptive = ELM_ADAPTIVETIMING;
00172     s->e_dlc = ELM_DISPLAYDLC;
00173 }
00174 
00175 /// Create a sorted list for the ECUs to respond in, based on their delays
00176 void ecudelay_order(struct simsettings *ss) {
00177     int i, j;
00178     for(i=0;i<ss->ecu_count;i++) {
00179         ss->ecudelays[i].ecu = &ss->ecus[i];
00180         ss->ecudelays[i].delay = ss->ecus[i].customdelay;
00181     }
00182 
00183     /* OH THE HORROR. BUBBLESORT [on the plus side, you only do it
00184          once, and you're only sorting six items]. Plus I haven't
00185          implemented a bubble sort in years and kinda felt like doing it. */
00186     for(i=0;i<ss->ecu_count;i++) {
00187         for(j=i+1;j<ss->ecu_count;j++) {
00188             if(ss->ecudelays[i].delay > ss->ecudelays[j].delay) {
00189                 struct obdgen_ecudelays tmp;
00190                 memcpy(&tmp,&ss->ecudelays[i],sizeof(tmp));
00191                 memcpy(&ss->ecudelays[i],&ss->ecudelays[j],sizeof(tmp));
00192                 memcpy(&ss->ecudelays[j],&tmp,sizeof(tmp));
00193             }
00194         }
00195     }
00196 
00197     /* for(i=0;i<ss->ecu_count;i++) {
00198         printf("ecudelay %i, num %i, delay %i\n", i,
00199             ss->ecudelays[i].ecu->ecu_num, ss->ecudelays[i].delay);
00200     } */
00201 
00202     // Now go through and convert all the delays to delta since the last one
00203     for(i=ss->ecu_count-1;i>0;i--) {
00204         ss->ecudelays[i].delay -= ss->ecudelays[i-1].delay;
00205     }
00206 
00207     /* for(i=0;i<ss->ecu_count;i++) {
00208         printf("ecudelay delta %i, num %i, delay %i\n", i,
00209             ss->ecudelays[i].ecu->ecu_num, ss->ecudelays[i].delay);
00210     } */
00211 }

00215 int spawnlogger(char *ptyname);

00218 int spawnscreen(char *ptyname);

00221 int spawntelnet(int portno);
00222 #endif // OBDPLATFORM_POSIX

00224 /// Find the generator of the given name
00225 static struct obdsim_generator *find_generator(const char *gen_name);
00226 
00227 /// Print the long description provided by the generator
00228 void show_genhelp(struct obdsim_generator *gen);
00229 
00230 /// Print the genrators this was linked with
00231 void printgenerator(int verbose);
00232 
00233 /// Types of sim ports
00234 enum simport_type {
00235     SIMPORT_DEFAULT,
00236     SIMPORT_SERIAL,
00237     SIMPORT_BLUETOOTH,
00238     SIMPORT_SOCKET
00239 };
00240 
00241 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
00242     // The "seed" passed in. Generator-specific
00243     char *seedstr = NULL;
00244 
00245     // Type of connection user wants
00246     simport_type simport_requested = SIMPORT_DEFAULT;
00247 
00248 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00249     // Whether to launch obdgpslogger attached to this sim
00250     int launch_logger = 0;
00251 
00252     // Whether to launch a terminal attached to this sim if possible
00253     int launch_terminal = 0;
00254 
00255     // If you should open a real device instead of a pty
00256     char *tty_device = NULL;
00257 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00258 
00259 #ifdef HAVE_SOCKET
00260     // Set if they wanted a socket connection
00261     int socket_port = 0;
00262 #endif //HAVE_SOCKET
00263 
00264     // Store all settings in here
00265     struct simsettings ss;
00266     obdsim_initialisesimsettings(&ss);
00267 
00268     // Logfilen name
00269     char *logfile_name = NULL;
00270     
00271 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00272     // Windows port to open
00273     char *winport = NULL;
00274 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00275     
00276     // Iterator/index into ecus
00277     int current_ecu = 0;
00278 
00279     int optc;
00280     int mustexit = 0;
00281     while ((optc = getopt_long (argc, argv, shortopts, longopts, NULL)) != -1) {
00282         switch (optc) {
00283             case 'h':
00284                 printhelp(argv[0]);
00285                 printgenerator(1);
00286                 mustexit = 1;
00287                 break;
00288             case 'e': {
00289                 struct obdsim_generator *h_gen = find_generator(optarg);
00290                 show_genhelp(h_gen);
00291                 mustexit = 1;
00292                 break;
00293             }
00294             case 'L':
00295                 printobdprotocols();
00296                 mustexit = 1;
00297                 break;
00298             case 'p':
00299                 if(0 != set_obdprotocol(optarg, &ss)) {
00300                     printf("Couldn't find protocol \"%s\", exiting\n", optarg);
00301                     mustexit = 1;
00302                 }
00303                 break;
00304             case 'l':
00305                 printgenerator(0);
00306                 mustexit = 1;
00307                 break;
00308             case 'n':
00309                 ss.benchmark = atoi(optarg);
00310                 break;
00311             case 'V':
00312                 if(NULL != ss.elm_version) {
00313                     free(ss.elm_version);
00314                 }
00315                 ss.elm_version = strdup(optarg);
00316                 break;
00317             case 'D':
00318                 if(NULL != ss.elm_device) {
00319                     free(ss.elm_device);
00320                 }
00321                 ss.elm_device = strdup(optarg);
00322                 break;
00323             case 'v':
00324                 printversion();
00325                 mustexit = 1;
00326                 break;
00327             case 'g':
00328                 if(OBDSIM_MAXECUS <= current_ecu) {
00329                     fprintf(stderr, "Only support %i ECUs in this build\n", OBDSIM_MAXECUS);
00330                     mustexit = 1;
00331                 } else {
00332                     ss.ecus[current_ecu].simgen = find_generator(optarg);
00333                     ss.ecus[current_ecu].ecu_num = current_ecu;
00334                     if(NULL == ss.ecus[current_ecu].simgen) {
00335                         fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't find generator \"%s\"\n", optarg);
00336                         mustexit = 1;
00337                     }
00338                     current_ecu++;
00339                 }
00340                 break;
00341             case 's':
00342                 if(current_ecu == 0) {
00343                     fprintf(stderr, "The seed must come after the generator\n");
00344                     mustexit=1;
00345                 }
00346                 if(NULL != ss.ecus[current_ecu-1].seed) {
00347                     fprintf(stderr, "Already provided a seed for generator %i\n", current_ecu);
00348                     mustexit=1;
00349                 }
00350                 ss.ecus[current_ecu-1].seed = strdup(optarg);
00351                 break;
00352             case 'd':
00353                 if(current_ecu == 0) {
00354                     fprintf(stderr, "The custom delay must come after the generator\n");
00355                     mustexit=1;
00356                 }
00357                 if(0 != ss.ecus[current_ecu-1].customdelay) {
00358                     fprintf(stderr, "Already provided a delay for generator %i\n", current_ecu);
00359                     mustexit=1;
00360                 }
00361                 ss.ecus[current_ecu-1].customdelay = atoi(optarg);
00362                 break;
00363             case 'q':
00364                 if(NULL != logfile_name) {
00365                     fprintf(stderr, "Warning! Multiple logs specified. Only last one will be used\n");
00366                     free(seedstr);
00367                 }
00368                 logfile_name = strdup(optarg);
00369                 break;
00370 #ifdef HAVE_BLUETOOTH
00371             case 'b':
00372                 simport_requested = SIMPORT_BLUETOOTH;
00373                 break;
00374 #endif //HAVE_BLUETOOTH
00375 #ifdef HAVE_SOCKET
00376             case 'k':
00377                 simport_requested = SIMPORT_SOCKET;
00378                 socket_port = atoi(optarg);
00379                 break;
00380 #endif //HAVE_SOCKET
00381 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00382             case 'o':
00383                 launch_logger = 1;
00384                 break;
00385             case 'c':
00386                 launch_terminal = 1;
00387                 break;
00388             case 't':
00389                 if(NULL != tty_device) {
00390                     free(tty_device);
00391                 }
00392                 tty_device = strdup(optarg);
00393                 break;
00394 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00395 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00396             case 'w':
00397                 if(NULL != winport) {
00398                     fprintf(stderr, "Warning! Multiple com port specified. Only last one will be used\n");
00399                     free(winport);
00400                 }
00401                 winport = strdup(optarg);
00402                 break;
00403 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00404             default:
00405                 mustexit = 1;
00406                 break;
00407         }
00408     }
00409 
00410     ss.ecu_count = current_ecu;
00411 
00412     if(NULL == ss.e_protocol) {
00413         fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't find initial protocol %s\n", OBDSIM_DEFAULT_PROTOCOLNUM);
00414         return 1;
00415     }
00416 
00417 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00418     if(launch_logger && launch_terminal) {
00419         fprintf(stderr, "Error: Cannot attach terminal and logger to same instance\n");
00420         mustexit = 1;
00421     }
00422 #endif // OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00423 
00424     if(0 == ss.ecu_count) {
00425         ss.ecus[0].ecu_num = 0;
00426         ss.ecus[0].simgen = find_generator(DEFAULT_SIMGEN);
00427         if(NULL == ss.ecus[0].simgen) {
00428             fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't find default generator \"%s\"\n", DEFAULT_SIMGEN);
00429             mustexit = 1;
00430         }
00431         ss.ecu_count++;
00432     }
00433 
00434     if(mustexit) return 0;
00435 
00436     
00437     int initialisation_errors = 0;
00438     int i;
00439     for(i=0;i<ss.ecu_count;i++) {
00440         if(0 != ss.ecus[i].simgen->create(&ss.ecus[i].dg, ss.ecus[i].seed)) {
00441             fprintf(stderr,"Couldn't initialise generator \"%s\" using seed \"%s\"\n",
00442                             ss.ecus[i].simgen->name(), ss.ecus[i].seed);
00443             initialisation_errors++;
00444         }
00445     }
00446     if(initialisation_errors > 0) {
00447         return 1;
00448     }
00449 
00450     /* Getting here means all the ECUs are up and running. Now alter
00451         the order they're queried in based on customdelay */
00452     ecudelay_order(&ss);
00453 
00454     // The sim port
00455     OBDSimPort *sp = NULL;
00456 
00457     switch(simport_requested) {
00458 #ifdef HAVE_SOCKET
00459         case SIMPORT_SOCKET:
00460             sp = new SocketSimPort(socket_port);
00461             break;
00462 #endif // HAVE_SOCKET
00463 #ifdef HAVE_BLUETOOTH
00464         case SIMPORT_BLUETOOTH:
00465             sp = new BluetoothSimPort();
00466             break;
00467 #endif // HAVE_BLUETOOTH
00468         case SIMPORT_DEFAULT:
00469         case SIMPORT_SERIAL:
00470         default:
00471 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00472             sp = new PosixSimPort(tty_device);
00473 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00474 
00475 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00476             if(NULL == winport) {
00477                 winport = strdup(DEFAULT_WINPORT);
00478             }
00479             sp = new WindowsSimPort(winport);
00480 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00481             break;
00482     }
00483 
00484     if(NULL == sp || !sp->isUsable()) {
00485         fprintf(stderr,"Error creating virtual port\n");
00486         return 1;
00487     }
00488 
00489     if(NULL != logfile_name) {
00490         sp->startLog(logfile_name);
00491     }
00492 
00493     char *slave_name = sp->getPort();
00494     if(NULL == slave_name) {
00495         printf("Couldn't get slave name for pty\n");
00496         delete sp;
00497         return 1;
00498     }
00499 
00500     printf("SimPort name: %s\n", slave_name);
00501 
00502 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00503     if(launch_logger) {
00504         spawnlogger(slave_name);
00505     }
00506     if(launch_terminal) {
00507         switch(simport_requested) {
00508 #ifdef HAVE_SOCKET
00509             case SIMPORT_SOCKET:
00510                 spawntelnet(socket_port);
00511                 break;
00512 #endif // HAVE_SOCKET
00513 #ifdef HAVE_BLUETOOTH
00514             case SIMPORT_BLUETOOTH:
00515                 printf("Don't know how to connect a terminal to bluetooth\n");
00516                 break;
00517 #endif //HAVE_BLUETOOTH
00518             case SIMPORT_DEFAULT:
00519             case SIMPORT_SERIAL:
00520             default:
00521                 spawnscreen(slave_name);
00522                 break;
00523         }
00524     }
00525 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00526 
00527     printf("Successfully initialised obdsim, entering main loop\n");
00528     main_loop(sp, &ss);
00529 
00530     for(i=0;i<ss.ecu_count;i++) {
00531         ss.ecus[i].simgen->destroy(ss.ecus[i].dg);
00532     }
00533 
00534     delete sp;
00535 
00536     if(NULL != logfile_name) {
00537         free(logfile_name);
00538     }
00539 
00540     if(NULL != seedstr) {
00541         free(seedstr);
00542     }
00543 
00544     if(NULL != ss.elm_version) {
00545         free(ss.elm_version);
00546     }
00547 
00548     if(NULL != ss.elm_device) {
00549         free(ss.elm_device);
00550     }
00551 
00552 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00553     if(NULL != winport) {
00554         free(winport);
00555     }
00556 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00557 
00558 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00559     if(NULL != tty_device) {
00560         free(tty_device);
00561     }
00562 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00563 
00564     return 0;
00565 }
00566 
00567 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00568 int spawnlogger(char *ptyname) {
00569     int pid = fork();
00570 
00571     if(-1 == pid) {
00572         perror("Couldn't fork");
00573         return 1;
00574     }
00575 
00576     if(0 < pid) {
00577         return 0;
00578     }
00579 
00580     // In child
00581     execlp("obdgpslogger", "obdgpslogger",
00582         "--baud", "-1",                      // Don't modify baudrate
00583         "--modifybaud", "-1",                // Don't upgrade baudrate
00584         "--serial", ptyname,                 // Connect to this pty
00585         "--db", "./obdgpsloggertmp.db",      // Dump to this database
00586         "--serial-log", "./serialcomms.txt", // Log serial comms to this file
00587         "--spam-stdout",                     // Spam stdout
00588         "--enable-optimisations",            // Enable elm optimisations
00589         NULL);
00590     perror("Couldn't exec obdgpslogger");
00591     exit(0);
00592 }
00593 
00594 int spawnscreen(char *ptyname) {
00595     int pid = fork();
00596 
00597     if(-1 == pid) {
00598         perror("Couldn't fork");
00599         return 1;
00600     }
00601 
00602     if(0 < pid) {
00603         // To avoid seeing console spam in screen, dump stdout
00604         int fd;
00605         close(STDOUT_FILENO);
00606         if ((fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0)) != -1) {
00607             dup2(fd, STDOUT_FILENO);
00608         }
00609 
00610         return 0;
00611     }
00612 
00613     // In child
00614     execlp("screen", "screen",
00615         ptyname,                 // Connect to this pty
00616         NULL);
00617     perror("Couldn't exec screen");
00618     exit(0);
00619 }
00620 
00621 int spawntelnet(int portno) {
00622     int pid = fork();
00623 
00624     if(-1 == pid) {
00625         perror("Couldn't fork");
00626         return 1;
00627     }
00628 
00629     if(0 < pid) {
00630         // To avoid seeing console spam, dump stdout
00631         int fd;
00632         close(STDOUT_FILENO);
00633         if ((fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0)) != -1) {
00634             dup2(fd, STDOUT_FILENO);
00635         }
00636 
00637         return 0;
00638     }
00639 
00640     // In child
00641     char portstr[8];
00642     snprintf(portstr, sizeof(portstr), "%i", portno);
00643 
00644     execlp("telnet", "telnet",
00645         "localhost",
00646         portstr,
00647         NULL);
00648     perror("Couldn't exec telnet");
00649     exit(0);
00650 }
00651 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00652 
00653 void show_genhelp(struct obdsim_generator *gen) {
00654     if(NULL == gen) {
00655         fprintf(stderr, "Cannot print help for nonexistent generator\n");
00656         return;
00657     }
00658 
00659     printf("Long help for generator \"%s\":\n\n%s\n\n", gen->name(),
00660         NULL==gen->longdesc?
00661             "Generator doesn't offer long description":
00662             gen->longdesc());
00663 }
00664 
00665 static struct obdsim_generator *find_generator(const char *gen_name) {
00666     size_t i;
00667     if(NULL == gen_name) return NULL;
00668 
00669     for(i=0; i<sizeof(available_generators)/sizeof(available_generators[0]); i++) {
00670         if(0 == strcmp(gen_name, available_generators[i]->name())) {
00671             return available_generators[i];
00672         }
00673     }
00674     return NULL;
00675 }
00676 
00677 int set_obdprotocol(const char *prot, struct simsettings *ss) {
00678     if(NULL == prot) {
00679         return -1;
00680     }
00681 
00682     // Allow spaces in various places even though behaviour isn't very well defined
00683     const char *p = prot;
00684     while(' ' == *p && '\0' != *p) p++;
00685     if('\0' == *p) {
00686         return -1;
00687     }
00688 
00689     int e_autoprotocol = 0;
00690     if('A' == *p || 'a' == *p) {
00691         e_autoprotocol = 1;
00692         p++;
00693     }
00694     while(' ' == *p && '\0' != *p) p++;
00695 
00696     struct obdiiprotocol *e_protocol = find_obdprotocol(p);
00697     p++;
00698     if(NULL == e_protocol) {
00699         return -1;
00700     }
00701     while(' ' == *p && '\0' != *p) p++;
00702 
00703     if('A' == *p || 'a' == *p) {
00704         e_autoprotocol = 1;
00705     }
00706 
00707     ss->e_protocol = e_protocol;
00708     ss->e_autoprotocol = e_autoprotocol;
00709 
00710     return 0;
00711 }
00712 
00713 struct obdiiprotocol *find_obdprotocol(const char *protocol_num) {
00714     int i;
00715     for(i=0; i<sizeof(obdprotocols)/sizeof(obdprotocols[0]); i++) {
00716         if(*protocol_num == obdprotocols[i].protocol_num) {
00717             return &(obdprotocols[i]);
00718         }
00719     }
00720     return NULL;
00721 }
00722

00724 void printhelp(const char *argv0) {
00725     printf("Usage: %s [params]\n"
00726         "   [-g|--generator=<name of generator>\n"
00727         "       [-s|--seed=<generator-seed>]\n"
00728         "       [-d|--customdelay=<ecu delay(ms)>]\n"
00729         "     ]\n"
00730         "   [-q|--logfile=<logfilename to write to>]\n"
00731         "   [-V|--elm-version=<pretend to be this on ATZ>]\n"
00732         "   [-D|--elm-device=<pretend to be this on AT@1>]\n"
00733         "   [-L|--list-protocols]\n"
00734         "   [-p|--protocol=<OBDII protocol>]\n"
00735 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00736         "   [-o|--launch-logger]\n"
00737         "   [-c|--launch-screen] [\"EXIT\" or C-a,k to exit]\n"
00738         "   [-t|--tty-device=<real /dev/ entry to open>]\n"
00739 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00740 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00741         "   [-w|--com-port=<windows COM port>]\n"
00742 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00743 #ifdef HAVE_BLUETOOTH
00744         "   [-b|--bluetooth]\n"
00745 #endif //HAVE_BLUETOOTH
00746 #ifdef HAVE_SOCKET
00747         "   [-k|--socket=<listen port>]\n"
00748 #endif //HAVE_SOCKET
00749         "   [-e|--genhelp=<name of generator>]\n"
00750         "   [-l|--list-generators]\n"
00751         "   [-n|--benchmark=<seconds>]\n"
00752         "   [-v|--version] [-h|--help]\n", argv0);
00753 }
00754 
00755 void printversion() {
00756     printf("Version: %i.%i\n", OBDGPSLOGGER_MAJOR_VERSION, OBDGPSLOGGER_MINOR_VERSION);
00757 }
00758 
00759 void printobdprotocols() {
00760     int i;
00761     for(i=0; i<sizeof(obdprotocols)/sizeof(obdprotocols[0]); i++) {
00762         printf("%c  %s\n", obdprotocols[i].protocol_num,  obdprotocols[i].protocol_desc);
00763     }
00764 }
00765 
00766 void printgenerator(int verbose) {
00767     if(verbose) {
00768         printf("The generators built into this sim:\n");
00769     }
00770 
00771     // If we find the one currently #defined as default
00772     int found_default = 0;
00773 
00774     size_t i;
00775     for(i=0; i<sizeof(available_generators)/sizeof(available_generators[0]); i++) {
00776         int is_default = !strcmp(DEFAULT_SIMGEN, available_generators[i]->name());
00777         if(is_default) found_default = 1;
00778         if(verbose) {
00779             printf(" \"%s\"%s\n", 
00780                 available_generators[i]->name(),
00781                 is_default?" (default)":"");
00782         } else {
00783             printf("%s%s\n", 
00784                 is_default?"* ":"  ",
00785                 available_generators[i]->name());
00786         }
00787     }
00788 
00789 
00790     if(0 == found_default && verbose) {
00791         printf("No default generator\n");
00792     }
00793 }
